lead_paragraph: To breathe new life into its sales, the celebrated piano maker is promoting its instruments to China’s growing middle class both as a status symbol and an investment.

byline.contributor: Zhang Tiantian and Sarah Li contributed research.

headline.main: Steinway’s Grand Ambitions for Its Pianos in China

snippet: To breathe new life into its sales, the celebrated piano maker is promoting its instruments to China’s growing middle class both as a status symbol and an investment....
abstract: Steinway says move to market their prestigious musical instruments in China has been paying off, with sales up 15 percent annually over last decade, far outpacing single-digit growth in United States and Europe; says decision meant developing strategy that emphasized high-end products as durable instruments and luxurious artifacts.
